solution_line_template: 5 pm-6 pm is one hour and they measure service in 15-minute blocks so {minutes_per_hour}/{block_duration_minutes} = <<{minutes_per_hour}/{block_duration_minutes}={num_15_min_blocks_per_hour}>>{num_15_min_blocks_per_hour} 15 min blocks

At peak times, they serve {peak_cars_per_block} cars every 15 minutes so they serve {peak_cars_per_block}*{num_15_min_blocks_per_hour} = <<{peak_cars_per_block}*{num_15_min_blocks_per_hour}={peak_cars_per_hour}>>{peak_cars_per_hour} cars in 60 minutes

Off peak times, 4pm-5 pm, they serve {off_peak_cars_per_block} cars every 15 minutes so they serve {off_peak_cars_per_block}*{num_15_min_blocks_per_hour} = <<{off_peak_cars_per_block}*{num_15_min_blocks_per_hour}={off_peak_cars_per_hour}>>{off_peak_cars_per_hour} cars in 60 minutes
From 4pm-5 pm they serve {off_peak_cars_per_hour} cars and from 5pm-6 pm they serve {peak_cars_per_hour} cars so they serve {off_peak_cars_per_hour}+{peak_cars_per_hour} = {total_cars_served} cars
